meanings.definition: A painful feeling of humiliation or distress caused by the consciousness of wrong or foolish behavior.
meanings.sent1: The boy felt great shame after being scolded in front of his classmates.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't bear the shame of forgetting her lines during the play.
meanings.sent3: It was a shame that he tripped over his own shoelaces during the race.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of shame followed her wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The shame of his mistake lingered long after the apology.

meanings.definition: A person, action, or situation that brings a loss of honor or respect.
meanings.sent1: The scandal was a great shame to the family's reputation.
meanings.sent2: He became a shame to his team after his dishonest actions were revealed.
meanings.sent3: It was a shame that the cake he baked turned out burnt.
meanings.sent4: The broken promise was a heavy weight of shame on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the monument was a public shame.

meanings.definition: To cause to feel shame; humiliate.
meanings.sent1: She didn't mean to shame him by pointing out his mistake.
meanings.sent2: The teacher shamed the student for not completing the assignment.
meanings.sent3: It would shame him if he knew we saw him dancing in his room.
meanings.sent4: The defeat in the final match shamed the entire team.
meanings.sent5: His behavior at the party shamed his family in front of their friends.
